page.title: 02The Mechanised Letter Office
page.content: The{MLO}was opened on{4 November 1983} to sort mail mechanically. Some mail must still be sorted manually. Letters are first sorted into 1st and 2nd class. At the{Facing Cancelling {Table 10}men can handle{30 000}letters whereas at the Manual Facing Table{16} men handle only{11 000.}1st class mail is sorted and franked immediately, 2nd class is left until later. Next the letters are sent through the{Coder.} The{Encoder}codes letters by{computer. He reads the code on the letter or adds a short code to uncoded letters. Thereare 2 rows of{fluorescent blue {dots}on coded letters and one row on uncoded letters. There are{24}code desks and each Encoder codes{1600} letters per hour.
